tit.cmt: 指示に従って、補足説明を付けました。

sen.j: 大番（おおばん、大御番）は、江戸幕府の組織の一つである。
sen.e: Oban (the great guards) was one of the military organizations of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Oban (the great guards) was one of the organizations of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: この文では、militaryに対する原語は記述されていないため、削除しました。
sen.e: Oban (the great guards) was one of the organizations of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 常備兵力として旗本を編制した部隊である。
sen.e: It was the troop which was formed by organizing hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu) as a standing force.
It was the troop which was formed by organizing hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu) as a standing force.
It was the troop which was formed by organizing hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu) as a standing force.

sen.j: 常備兵力としての大番は、同様の組織である五番方（小姓組、書院番、新番、大番、小十人）の中で最も古い。
sen.e: Oban as a standing force was the oldest forces among the same military organizations called gobangata (the collective name of five military organizations in the Edo period) (kosho-gumi [the page corps]), shoinban [the castle guards], shinban [the new guards], oban [the great guards], and kojunin [the escort guards]).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Oban as a standing force was the oldest force among the similar organization called gobangata (the collective name of five military organizations in the Edo period: kosho-gumi [the page corps], shoinban [the castle guards], shinban [the new guards], oban [the great guards], and kojunin [the escort guards]).
sen.cmt: ・ここでは大番はひとつの兵力なので、forces→forceとしました。・「同様」はthe sameとは意味が異なるので、a similarとしました。五番方がひとつの組織であるため単数形にしています。・丸括弧内の丸括弧を削除しました。また、わかりやすくするため、括弧内の説明をつなげました。
sen.e: Oban as a standing force was the oldest force among the similar organization called gobangata (the collective name of five military organizations in the Edo period: kosho-gumi [the page corps], shoinban [the castle guards], shinban [the new guards], oban [the great guards], and kojunin [the escort guards]).

sen.j: 石川数正が出奔した翌年の天正14年（1586年）に徳川家康が徳川家の軍制を武田流に変更した際に編制された。
sen.e: Oban was organized in 1586, the year following the Kazumasa ISHIKAWA's escape, when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA changed his military system to the system used in the army of Takeda.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Oban was organized in 1586, the year following the Kazumasa ISHIKAWA's escape, when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA changed his military system to the system used in the army of Takeda.
Oban was organized in 1586, the year following the Kazumasa ISHIKAWA's escape, when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA changed his military system to the system used in the army of Takeda.

sen.j: 内藤信政ら6名が最初の大番頭に就任した。
sen.e: Six people including Nobumasa NAITO were installed as the first oban-gashira (the captains of the great guards).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Six people including Nobumasa NAITO were installed as the first oban-gashira (the captains of the great guards).
Six people including Nobumasa NAITO were installed as the first oban-gashira (the captains of the great guards).

sen.j: 文禄元年（1592年）には江戸城改築にともない、当時あった6組の屋敷地を江戸城北西側に設けている。
sen.e: In 1592, with the reconstruction of Edo Castle, the six residences were moved from the previous places and situated in the east side of Edo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1592, with the reconstruction of Edo Castle, the six residences were moved from the previous places and situated in the east side of Edo Castle.
In 1592, with the reconstruction of Edo Castle, the six residences were moved from the previous places and situated in the east side of Edo Castle.

sen.j: （千代田区には一番町 (千代田区)から六番町 (千代田区)までの地名が現在も残る。）
sen.e: (In Chiyoda-ku, the six districts, from Ichiban-cho to Rokuban-cho [from the first district to the sixth district], whose names are related to the six residential sites, still remain.)
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (In Chiyoda-ku, the six districts, from Ichiban-cho to Rokuban-cho [from the first district to the sixth district], whose names are related to the six residential sites, still remain.)
(In Chiyoda-ku, the six districts, from Ichiban-cho to Rokuban-cho [from the first district to the sixth district], whose names are related to the six residential sites, still remain.)

sen.j: 開幕前の大番は松平氏や家康の縁類が番頭に就く事が多かった。
sen.e: Before the Edo period began, the Matsudaira clan and the relatives of Ieyasu were often hired as the captain of oban.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before the Edo period began, the Matsudaira clan and the relatives of Ieyasu were often hired as the captain of oban.
Before the Edo period began, the Matsudaira clan and the relatives of Ieyasu were often hired as the captain of oban.

sen.j: この当時は後の両番のような親衛隊的側面も有していた。
sen.e: At the time, oban had a role as the bodyguard which was later succeeded by ryoban.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the time, oban had a role as the bodyguard which was later succeeded by ryoban.
At the time, oban had a role as the bodyguard which was later succeeded by ryoban.

sen.j: 大番は当初は6組であった。
sen.e: At first, oban consisted of six units.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At first, oban consisted of six units.
At first, oban consisted of six units.

sen.j: その後の増強と幕府制度の整備にともない、本丸老中支配として12組となる。
sen.e: Following the enhancement of oban and the improvement of the bakufu system, oban consisted of twelve units, serving as Honmaru-roju-shihai.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処「本丸老中支配」→意味＆定訳が不明です。
sen.e: Following the enhancement of oban and the improvement of the bakufu system, oban consisted of twelve units, serving as Honmaru-roju-shihai.
Following the enhancement of oban and the improvement of the bakufu system, oban consisted of twelve units, serving as Honmaru-roju-shihai.

sen.j: 徳川秀忠が将軍に就任し、書院番・小姓組（創設当初は花畑番）が新たに創設された。
sen.e: When Tadahide TOKUGAWA was installed as Shogun, Shoinban and Koshogumi (originally it was called Hanabatake-ban (literally, "Guards at the Flower Garden") [It was called "Hanabatake-ban" because there was a flower garden in front of Kuroshoin-saikonoma, the first place where Koshogumi guarded]) were newly created.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処「花畑番」→意味＆定訳が不明ですが、yahoo百科事典の解説を参考にしてあります。http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/%E5%B0%8F%E5%A7%93%E7%B5%84%E7%95%AA/
sen.e: When Tadahide TOKUGAWA was installed as Shogun, Shoinban and Koshogumi (originally it was called Hanabatake-ban [literally, "Guards at the Flower Garden" because there was a flower garden in front of Kuroshoin-saikonoma, the first place where Koshogumi guarded]) were newly created.
sen.cmt: 括弧の中の括弧が丸括弧になっていたため、修正しました。修正の際には、後に続く補足説明が重複していたため統合しました。
sen.e: When Tadahide TOKUGAWA was installed as Shogun, Shoinban and Koshogumi (originally it was called Hanabatake-ban [literally, "Guards at the Flower Garden" because there was a flower garden in front of Kuroshoin-saikonoma, the first place where Koshogumi guarded]) were newly created.

sen.j: 親衛隊側面はそちらに移行し、大番は幕府の直轄軍事力となってゆく。
sen.e: The role as a guardian was taken over by shoinban and koshogumi and oban gradually became the military force under the direct control of the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The role as a guardian was taken over by shoinban and koshogumi and oban gradually became a military force under the direct control of the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 幕府の軍事力はひとつに限定できないため、military forceは不定冠詞に変えました。
sen.e: The role as a guardian was taken over by shoinban and koshogumi and oban gradually became a military force under the direct control of the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: そのため、将軍・大御所・世子の親衛隊ではない大番が西の丸に置かれる事はない。
sen.e: Since Oban was not the guardians of a shogun, an ogosho (a retired shogun), and a seishi (the heir), oban wasn't placed to Nishinomaru (the western enceinte).
Since Oban was not the guardians of a shogun, an ogosho (a retired shogun), and a seishi (the heir), oban was not placed to Nishinomaru (the western enceinte).
sen.cmt: wasn'tはくだけた感じなので、was notとしました。
sen.e: Since Oban was not the guardians of a shogun, an ogosho (a retired shogun), and a seishi (the heir), oban was not placed to Nishinomaru (the western enceinte).

sen.j: 1つの組は番頭1名、組頭4名、番士50名、与力10名、同心20名で構成される。
sen.e: One oban unit consisted of one ban-gashira (the captain), four kumi-gashira (the leaders), fifty banshi (the guards), ten yoriki (the constables), and twenty doshin (the policemen).
One oban unit consisted of one ban-gashira (the captain), four kumi-gashira (the leaders), fifty banshi (the guards), ten yoriki (the constables), and twenty doshin (the policemen).
One oban unit consisted of one ban-gashira (the captain), four kumi-gashira (the leaders), fifty banshi (the guards), ten yoriki (the constables), and twenty doshin (the policemen).

sen.j: 番頭は役高5000石の伺候席であった。
sen.e: Bangashira held a fief of 5,000 koku and was given the shiko-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Bangashira held a fief of 5,000 koku and was given the shiko-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with shogun).
Bangashira held a fief of 5,000 koku and was given the shiko-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with shogun).

sen.j: しばしば大名が就任した（開幕初期はその傾向が特に強い）。
sen.e: Often a daimyo was installed as a ban-gashira (especially, such tendency was often seen during the early years of the Edo bakufu).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Often a daimyo was installed as a ban-gashira (especially, such tendency was often seen during the early years of the Edo bakufu).
Often a daimyo was installed as a ban-gashira (especially, such tendency was often seen during the early years of the Edo bakufu).

sen.j: 組頭は役高300石、役料100俵の躑躅間席。
sen.e: Kumigashira, with a fief of 300 koku and a salary of 100 sacks of rice, was given the tsutsujinoma-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kumigashira, with a fief of 300 koku and a salary of 100 sacks of rice, was given the tsutsujinoma-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with a shogun).
Kumigashira, with a fief of 300 koku and a salary of 100 sacks of rice, was given the tsutsujinoma-seki (a waiting place, arranged in descending order of rank, to have an audience with a shogun).

sen.j: 番士は持ち高勤め（足高制による補填がない）であるがだいたい200石高の旗本が就任した。
sen.e: The hatamoto with a fief of about 200 koku was installed as banshi, although the installation to banshi was decided by the amount of his fief (the shortfall was not covered by the ashidakasei [a wage system that guaranteed standardized compensation by the Tokugawa bakufu officials]).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The hatamoto with a fief of about 200 koku was installed as banshi, although the installation to banshi was decided by the amount of his fief (the shortfall was not covered by the ashidakasei [a wage system that guaranteed standardized compensation by the Tokugawa bakufu officials]).

The hatamoto with a fief of about 200 koku was installed as banshi, although the installation to banshi was decided by the amount of his fief (the shortfall was not covered by the ashidakasei [a wage system that guaranteed standardized compensation by the Tokugawa bakufu officials]).

sen.j: 役高に規定される番士の軍役から計算した総兵力は400人強となった。
sen.e: The total military forces calculated by the number of banshi joined the military service which was decided on the basis of the yakudaka (the amount of the person's fief) were over four hundreds.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The total military forces calculated by the number of banshi who joined the military service which was decided on the basis of the yakudaka (the amount of the person's fief) were over four hundreds.
sen.cmt: joinは、この場合他動詞になるため、主語のwhoを加えました。
sen.e: The total military forces calculated by the number of banshi who joined the military service which was decided on the basis of the yakudaka (the amount of the person's fief) were over four hundreds.

sen.j: 2万石程度の大名の軍役に匹敵した。
sen.e: The number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with about a fief of 20,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with about a fief of 20,000 koku.
The number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with about a fief of 20,000 koku.

sen.j: （『岩淵夜話』によると5万石に比例するとしている。）
sen.e: (According to "Iwabuchitawa" (Night Stories of Iwabuchi), the number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with a fief of 50,000 koku.)
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (According to "Iwabuchiyawa" [Night Stories of Iwabuchi], the number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with a fief of 50,000 koku.)
sen.cmt: ・指示に従って、丸括弧の中の括弧は[]としました。・Iwabuchitawa→Iwabuchiyawaの誤記です。
sen.e: (According to "Iwabuchiyawa" [Night Stories of Iwabuchi], the number was equal to the total military forces of the daimyo with a fief of 50,000 koku.)

sen.j: 職務は、戦時においては旗本部隊の一番先手として各種足軽組等を付属した上で備の騎馬隊として働いた。
sen.e: In wartime, as the vanguard of a hatamoto troop, oban with various ashigaru-gumi (the teams of the lowest-rank samurai) served as cavalry for defense against an attack by the enemy.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In wartime, as the vanguard of a hatamoto troop, oban with various ashigaru-gumi (the teams of the lowest-rank samurai) served as cavalry for defense against an attack by the enemy.
In wartime, as the vanguard of a hatamoto troop, oban with various ashigaru-gumi (the teams of the lowest-rank samurai) served as cavalry for defense against an attack by the enemy.

sen.j: 平時には江戸城下および要地の警護を担当する。
sen.e: In peacetime, oban guarded Edo Castle town and other important places.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In peacetime, oban guarded Edo Castle town and other important places.
In peacetime, oban guarded Edo Castle town and other important places.

sen.j: 大番の警護する要地には二条城および大坂城がある。
sen.e: The important places where oban guarded were Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The important places where oban guarded were Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle.
The important places where oban guarded were Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle.

sen.j: それぞれに2組が1年交代で在番する。
sen.e: Two pairs of oban were assigned to each castle as the guard, working in alternate one-year shifts.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Two pairs of oban were assigned to each castle as the guard, working in alternate one-year shifts.
Two pairs of oban were assigned to each castle as the guard, working in alternate one-year shifts.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期にはこのほかに伏見城と駿府城の警護に当たっっていたが、伏見在番は伏見廃城により、駿府在番は書院番が勤めることになり、それぞれ廃止された。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, in addition to Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle, oban guarded Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle; however, the guard of Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle were abolished because Fushimi Castle was razed and the guard of Sunpu Castle was taken over by shoinban.

In the early Edo period, in addition to Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle, oban guarded Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle; however, the guard of Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle were abolished because Fushimi Castle was razed and the guard of Sunpu Castle was taken over by shoinban.

In the early Edo period, in addition to Nijo Castle and Osaka Castle, oban guarded Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle; however, the guard of Fushimi Castle and Sunpu Castle were abolished because Fushimi Castle was razed and the guard of Sunpu Castle was taken over by shoinban.

sen.j: 大番は歴史が古いものの、「両番」と称せられる小姓組、書院番に比べ家格は一段低いとされた。
sen.e: Although oban was the oldest military organization, the social standing was lower than koshogumi and shoinban which were called "ryoban."
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although oban was the oldest military organization, the social standing was lower than koshogumi and shoinban which were called "ryoban."
Although oban was the oldest military organization, the social standing was lower than koshogumi and shoinban which were called "ryoban."

sen.j: 番士たちの出世の途は限られていた。
sen.e: Due to this fact, the banshi had limited career ladder opportunities.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to this fact, the banshi had limited career ladder opportunities.
Due to this fact, the banshi had limited career ladder opportunities.

sen.j: なお、薩摩藩では家格が整備されるまで、後年に御小姓与と新番の身分に分別された武士を大番と呼んでいた。
sen.e: In Satsuma Domain, until the social ranks were organized, the samurai whose family ranks were later divided into okoshogumi and shinban (new guards) were called oban.
In Satsuma Domain, until the social ranks were organized, the samurai whose family ranks were later divided into okoshogumi and shinban (new guards) were called oban.
In Satsuma Domain, until the social ranks were organized, the samurai whose family ranks were later divided into okoshogumi and shinban (new guards) were called oban.
